overview:
We Paid in Blood, Sweat and Tears.  Sorry for the graphic photo, but this is one of my buddy's body armor who was wounded in Afghanistan.  He fortunately survived, but this is just one of the many sacrifices we made to honor our end of the contracts.

The CA Army National Guard offered bonuses to soldiers who had specifically needed job skills, and were willing to sign up for 3-or 6 -year enlistments from 2006 to 2010. After 17,000 soldiers signed the contracts, and in most cases completed the 6-year enlistments, many of which included combat tours, the National Guard sent letters to the soldiers stating they have to pay back the bonuses. The Army National Guard admittedly lacked manpower and oversight of their program and personnel in charge of the program. 

Apparently, they discovered several cases of suspected fraud. Mostly the recruiters, who received incentives for recruiting soldiers. They convicted the NCO in charge of the program while higher ranking officers dodged punishment.  In one of her defenses, she stated she was ordered to keep the personnel numbers up.  In the meantime they did an audit and discovered minor mistakes in nearly 17,000 contracts and suggested they were all written in violation of Federal law. 

Rather than investigate each contract and making a decision as to whether or not there was criminal intent with each one, they simply decided they don't have to honor any of them. As for the soldiers, including myself, we signed the contracts in good faith, believing they were legitimate.  Those long term contracts pretty much insured we would be deployed to combat.  The purpose of the incentive program was to maintain their numbers so they could deploy troops to Afghanistan and Iraq.  They got what they wanted, then once the war in Iraq ended they are taking back the funds.  

Not surprisingly, since the rise of ISIS, they are offering a bonus to soldiers with specifically needed Job Skills, once again.  We detrimentally relied on those contracts when we deployed.  Several of my friends and I were involved in one of the most dangerous missions of our lives during that contract.  I was knocked unconscious at one point when a roadside bomb struck my vehicle.  Many of my friends were wounded during the conflict and some received purple hearts.  I am still being treated  for my injuries 10 years later.  If it were not for the bravery of those serving on my left and right, I don't know that any of us would have made it home. 

Like many other soldiers, I honorably completed my contract in 2012 and two years later they sent me a letter stating I had to pay the money back.  Each contract has a different excuse. They stated the reason I was not eligible for the contract was because I had over 20 years of service at the time.  I had originally signed up more than 20 years prior, but had breaks in service and only had 15 credible years of service, not 20.  Although at the time, they informed me I was eligible for a bonus, now they are saying I was not.  This is the justification they are using for not honoring the contract 10 years later. 

I have a legally binding contract promising me the money in return for 6 years of service and I did my part.  They can't give me my time back.  Time I could have used in a better paying career.  They can't erase the things I have done or seen, or erase my injuries.  How can they just take the money back without a judgment and without my permission?

This should scare every American. With regard to the statute of limitations, they stated there was a code in the Food Conservation and Energy Act of 2008, better known as (The Farm Bill) that allows them to collect all debts, including those previously ineligible for collection, without limitation.  Can the IRS also use this excuse to do tax audits from the day we first started paying taxes and charge us penalties? To add insult to injury, I received a $15,000 bonus for a 6-year term.  They pre-taxed the bonus only paying me approximately $11,000 after the tax was taken out.  But are now saying I have to pay the entire $15,000 back plus interest. They are demanding I pay them the $4,000 all ready paid to the IRS. 

After 90 days they turned my debt over to the Department of the Treasury, who fined me a 28% penalty, including a penalty on the $4,000 paid to the IRS.  So now I owe the government almost $20,000, when they were the ones who wrote the contract that they state is not valid.  I'm being fined and penalized for their incompetence and lack of oversight and the Treasury Department is now trying garnishing my civilian wages. 

The National Guard did create an over burdensome, procedural obstacle course, that requires soldiers to admit they received an erroneous payment, then beg the CA National Guard to forgive them for receiving said payment.  It takes a year and a half or longer just to see if we will be forgiven as if we did something wrong. The procedure takes so long because they continue to lack the manpower to review the paperwork they make us fill out, however in the meantime, they have a large enough task force to continue garnishing soldiers wages against their will, without a court order, report unpaid debt, to credit bureaus, and collect from soldier's tax returns. 

One of my fellow soldiers was on another deployment when he received his collection letter, and while he should have been focusing on the battlefield, he had to worry about his family's well being back home, because they garnished his entire paycheck. 

I transferred out of the National Guard in order to avoid their illegal wage garnishments, however, they made it very clear, they will take it from my tax returns.  I have heard, that there were at least three soldiers who were killed in Afghanistan, and one committed suicide and their spouses received collection letters.  This sickens me beyond belief. Now that I was out of the military and struggling to provide for my wife and two babies, they are demanded I pay them almost $500 a month.  They have quite literally ruined my life, with months and months of mental anguish,and sleepless nights.  They defamed my character, when they reported the bonus promised to me as unpaid debt to all three credit bureaus, and dropped my otherwise near perfect credit score almost 150 points, making it impossible to get any loans for business I'm working on. The very entity that did not have the proper oversight to follow the proper procedures to get the contracts right in the first place, now lacks the proper oversight to follow the proper procedures in their collection activities, and are dodging legal due process as a result.

My argument is this. If they feel the contracts were not valid 10 years after the fact, they need to either file criminal charges against those who they feel may have committed illegally activity, or they need to file civil charges against those who they feel were not eligible for the bonuses.  The CA Army National Guard and Defense Finance and Accounting Service are each just one of thousands of government and state agencies, they are in no way the supreme governmental authority, and lack the legal jurisdiction to act as a judge in any legal dispute, let alone one that they are party to. 

Yet they are completely skirting legal due process. Like any other entity, when it comes contract law, should they decide to dispute the contract after it's been completed, the burden to seek a decision by an independent court or other tribunal falls upon them, and without a judgment from said court or tribunal, they have no legal authority to garnish wages, or conduct any other collection activities. This is not an unpaid dept. This is money that was promised as part of a contractual agreement, which I, and many other soldiers like me honorably fulfilled with blood, sweat, and tears.

We pride ourselves with honor in the military. There is a term called honoring a contract, because it's not only the legal thing to do, but because it's an honorable thing to do. In regard to minor dependencies they found years after the contracts were completed during an audit, the CA Army National Guard should honor contracts soldiers signed in good faith and honorably completed. If they choose to be dishonorable and not honor them, they must be made to seek a judgment from a non partisan court or tribunal and immediately cease their illegal collection activities until a judgment is made in their favor. We are just soldiers, who did nothing wrong. 

We did what we promised to do, and we are being punished for it.  The National Guard Bureau, and Defense Finance and Accounting, conned us in, and are now actually profiteering from their misrepresentation, and lack of oversight.  This is despicable. 

If you support the ones who sacrificed so much, please stand with us sign this petition and pass it on.  We really need America's support.  Thank you. Soldiers.  If you received a bonus recoup letter also, please email me at robert_richmond@yahoo.com.  I want to make sure you are represented. For anyone who is able to and would like to donate for court cost, please nothing large, just a small $5 donation would really help. click the link below. Thank you so much. https://www.youcaring.com/military-personnel-s-court-costs-and-legal-fees-529281#.VtE_rtePnsI.facebook

Feel free to read related links http://www.courthousenews.com/2016/02/12/re-enlisted-guardsmen-balk-at-bonus-grab.htm http://sacramento.cbslocal.com/2013/10/08/call-kurtis-thousands-of-soldiers-told-they-may-have-to-pay-bonus-money-back/
title: Stop Army from taking back signing bonuses 10 years later, after vets completed contracts.

updates.content:
I had searched high and low for a lawyer willing to file a class action law suit on our behalf for over a year now.  It was very difficult to find one willing to take these guys on with all the red tape.  Well a class action has been started to get our money back.  Not for damages.  Half the battle is finding out who all the soldier are who received bonus recoup letters.  So if you are one, please email me directly at robert_richmond@yahoo.com, and I will make sure you are represented.  write me for details.  Thank you all for your service.  I am personally going to do everything in my power to fight for all of you.  Please keep this petition moving, the world need to know.

 SFC Robert J. Richmond
 US Army, Special Forces
updates.title: Attention Soldiers who are having their bonuses recouped

updates.content:
For everyone who has signed my petition and shared it.  Thank you so much for your support.  We can't do it without your help.  A class action lawsuit has been filed by a lawyer and friend of one of the soldiers in the recoup.  I couldn't find a lawyer willing to take on the National Guard and Defense Finance Accounting Service in CA.  God knows I tried.  The Lawyer, Daniel Willman, lives in Michigan, and has been spending his own dime to fly to CA to hand this.  We are not suing for damages and court costs so we have to come up with the funds on our own.  Mr. Willman says if every soldier in the class action pays $15 or so, that would be enough to help fund this.  I frankly think every soldier in the military has already wrote the ultimate check when they signed the dotted line, and shouldn't have to pay anything.  That's why I'm so mad.  The burden should have been on the CA National Guard, not the soldier who did nothing wrong.  So please don't feel obligated, and please don't make any large donations.  For those of you who are in a financial position to do so, a simple $5.00 donation would go a long way.  Those troops who have already sacrificed so much would surely appreciate it.  Not everyone is in a good financial position these days, and a lot of people are not comfortable making payments online.  No worries, just please share our petition.  Thanks again everyone, I personally appreciate each and everyone of you.  I have made it priority to read everyone of your comments and will continue to do so until too many people join in. 

https://www.youcaring.com/military-personnel-s-court-costs-and-legal-fees-529281#.VtE_rtePnsI.facebook
updates.title: Funding Class Action Law Suit

updates.content: Thank you everyone who has taken the time to sign this petition.  Unfortunately it has lost momentum, but is so very important.  Please if you have already signed this, share it with everyone you can think of.  Especially if you are one of the effected soldiers.  It carries no weight with less than 100,000 signatures.  That means we each need to try to get 100 more people to sign it.  Help me help you.  Please share and promote this to give it new life.  Thank you.
updates.title: Please share this petition

updates.content: As part of their continued vicious attack on soldiers who signed contracts in good faith, the Army has now turned my collection over to the Treasury Department who tacked on a 28% penalty on day one and have demanded payment in 10 days.  Per the Army's instructions, I filled out paperwork to dispute their actions, and they stated they are too overwhelmed to get to it, so it will take 12 months before they will get around to reviewing the paperwork.  They don't have enough manpower?  They are pretending to have a remedy for soldiers who signed contracts in good faith, but it will take a year to wait for their decision.  They have enough personnel to add penalties and send out collection letters each month.  It only took them 30 days to send letters to all three collection agencies ruining my perfect credit which ruined a project I was working on, making it difficult to earn money to take care of my family, and it only took them a little over 90 days to send my collection to the Treasury department.  The minimum time they are required to wait before turning a debt over to them.  They have enough time and manpower to ruin soldiers lives who did nothing wrong, but not enough time process these alleged remedies they have provided for soldiers.  Thank you everybody for your support, but please, please share this petition with everyone you know. This is not right. 17,000 Soldiers who laid their lives on the line for their country shouldn't be victims of government abuse.  I remember my first week in Iraq, we came under enemy mortar fire that resulted in 6 casualties.  There were so many holes in each casualty, that half of our team had to plug them with their fingers while 2 medics frantically treated the casualties one at a time while the other half of the team returned fire.  That's what we did to honor our end of the contracts.  We were a little short on manpower and we got the job done in an hour.  They have about half a million soldiers stateside and nobody shooting at them and they can't review our cases, but they have time to screw our lives up after all we gave. Thank you once again for your support
updates.title: Army continue to pours salt in the wound.

updates.content:
First and foremost.  Thank you everyone for your continued support.  To date I have read everyone of your comments.  

Soldiers who have received bonus recoup letters.  A class action law suit was started some time ago.  The Army has attempted to squash the law suit, by telling the primary named soldier on the class action suit, that his case is unique, and they will forgive him of his debt, but there is no need for a class action suit because the Army has offered a remedy for soldiers who signed contracts in good faith.  We all know that remedy is not fair, takes years to go through in some cases, and they have ruined our lives, credit, and have been their own judge in jury.  So you guys need to write letters for the lawyer to present on Oct. 20th.  Please read instructions below.

Please convert all letters into PDF Form.

 

Thank You

S/Daniel C. Willman

 


In a message dated 9/25/2016 12:10:49 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, strother_bryan@yahoo.com writes:



All,   (please forward to interested/ involved parties)

 

  On Oct 20th Attorney Willman will be here in Sac responding to the DOD attorney's attempt to quash this "our" class action suit.  As I have advised "DOD" is trying to make this suit go away quietly.  DODs main focus to Quash the case is that there are "clear available remedies" for those affected and that my case is unique.  My case is not unique! Ten years of Appeals (legal foot dragging) in my case is not a "clear available remedy!" Willman now needs to prove this with at least a half dozen individuals to come forward and write a short letter in how this has affected you, you family, your career etc.  See my letter attached as example. It also needs to be notarized.  This brings letters to a higher level of credibility in the courtroom. Your letter will also become a focal point in  the case, and dissolve DODs "make them go away" scheme.  I notarized mine at the UPS store, or bank, I wrote my letter on open office you can down load free. You will need to sign your letter in front of the notary.  Willman needs these letters no later than one week to have them submitted for the 20 Oct hearing. Scan your letter with notary service attached and forward to Attorney Willman : danielCwillman@aol.com                   Sincerely, B. Strother

Stars and Stripes covers petition efforts

updates.content: Soldiers and fellow military personnel from other services, than you for your sacrifices.  American Citizens, for the first time in our lives, the military is helpless unless you stand up and fight for us.  Congress has only suspended collection action, while they spend 8 more months to investigate.  They are holding money that belongs to military personnel from all states and services who are already homeless, losing their houses, or struggling to get by.  They still plan to act as their own judge and jury in their decision making, and have no intention of giving soldiers their rights to legal due process promised in the Constitution.  They very Constitution we swore an oath to defend.  Please share this Petition will all your friends one last time to help push it over the min 100K signatures required.  Thank you for your continued support.
updates.title: Please Share this Petition One More Time

reasons.content: I'm signing because the men and women of the United States military have been taken advantage of for too long and continue to be subjected to this behavior. They have sacrificed over and over again, yet they are one of the most incredibly neglected and overlooked group of citizens in this nation. The fact that our freedom has ridden on the backs of these men and women, who were brave enough to stand in place for every one of us who have fearfully rejected being exposed to such devastating circumstances, need to be supported and taken care of. I am disappointed, disgusted, and ashamed to hear that the only "answer" that could be conjured up is to subject judgment and punishment upon many for the deplorable decisions of a few. The men and women of our United States military should not have to pay for the mistakes of others, especially after they agreed to risk their lives in hellish situations for extended tours of duty and were promised this additional compensation as a means to offset their incredibly selfless decision to fight for and on behalf of each and every one of us. Don't pass this opportunity to do what's right and risk tarnishing the good names of these people and our country. Creating terrible perceptions of our military will not only have lasting effects on those who currently serve, but will also create a devastating precedent that will only help to deter every person who would consider joining this elite group of warriors. I implore that this situation be reexamine and the fulfillment and restoration of this situation be revealed in favor of these who's trust has clearly been disaffirmed.

I am one to these soldiers. i have been fighting for 4 years to get my bonus. being blamed for what the recruiter did or didn't do. I have done all required of me, along with a few of my battle buddies,yet we are held to blame for the mistake.

It is unfair for this government to take away from these men, women and their families who have given so much to this country. I have seen what it has done to many of our friends who had great credit just to have it ruined by one individual and the government wanting more than what they gave. This government will never be able to repay some of these men that come back with PTSD, just to be told they know have this debt and that their credit is going to Shit. Their families have it hard enough,  just to have this make it worse. 

PLEASE give them what is rightfully due to them for their service and fix their credit. You owe them that much for their sacrifices.

All military members are at one point joining or rejoining for their own reasons, then when it's time to depart from service. A snake appears with a contract and pen, with a offer sometimes that is too good to refuse, the contract will offer a signing bonus for an amount. The servicemen rethink their options and sign the contract without any hesitation knowing and believing that it is honored being the U.S. military and all. Then you receive letters in the mail from state governors thanking you for your service completion. Then you get a letter telling you, "YOU OWE US OUR MONEY BACK WITH INTEREST. PAY US OR WE'LL TAKE IT BY ANY MEANS" When someone at the top of the chain doesn't take accountability for their own actions, this is the end result. Obviously this isn't fair for all who have completed their contract. Plus Mr. Richmond is an honest man, served his his country in very good faith. Now he deserves to be happy. Not fighting a political war with whoever is not confessing to their mistakes, too long ago. Please help this man and others like him in this position. He served well for you....and this country. Sign the petition.....

I got a bonus recoupment letter after I completed my service. I know the soldier who was deployed to Afghanistan when they recouped those funds. They did the same thing to that soldiers wife also. So they were making no money (he had to stay at home to care for the kids while she was taking her turn on a deployment. You hit the nail on the head with this Rob. I was one of the few fortunate ones who had my 10 year old documentation clearly indicating the reason for my bonuses as well as a copy of the regulations that justified them. When I pressed the poor specialist who answered my 3rd phone call (worst detail ever) as to the legality of this process I asked him some of the same questions that you pointed out, Rob. I also asked them that since the bonus portion of the contract was not valid, then the entire contract was not valid (basic four corners doctrine of contract law) if they would be letting people out early without penalty. Of course the answer was no. This is truly a travesty. The vast vast majority of us served with honor and upheld all of the army values, day in and day out. We ignored our needs, our families needs and our friends opinions. We answered our nation's call to service because our nation needed our help, and this is the Thank you we receive. If these soldiers have to pay back bonuses that were impossible to verify the legitimacy of, it would be an unfathomable miscarriage of justice. Surely I cannot give them back the nightmares, changed personality, or insomnia, nor would I want to quite honestly. My scars remind my of my service and provide me with perspective. It is such a shame that the California Army National Guard could not leave bad enough alone.
My sister is in the ARMY National Guard; my husband is a Marine and my son-in-law too! This is unfair and must stop! We wouldn't be the great country we are, if not for our fighting forces!! 

Signing this is the right thing to do. I am GRATEFUL for their willingness to serve, and protect our lives, and our government should also be grateful. How dare we take back bonuses from these soldiers and their families. It's outrageous!
Army needs to honor contracts that have been completed
This is an unconscionable breach of trust and an example of an uncaring, out of control bureaucracy.
Our men and women who serve this country should be granted this and so much more
I support our troops, and their right to be treated fairly.
I also have an unfulfilled signing bonus with the CA National Guard.
Lord don't even get me started. This country does not take well enough care of the men and women who put their lives on the line to protect it. It is a huge injustice and has to change.

I see this collection activity as a injustice. How can the SM be held responsible and punished like this when they committed no wrong doing. The SM completed the contract they agreed to. They trusted the NCO's and Officers offering the deal were properly trained and acting in good faith. The CARNG needs to just eat this and if they think the SM was aware of the crime then they need to prove it to a judge. Just cause they wear the uniform. Of this Nation does not mean they forfeit their right to due process and their day in court.

These men and women largely acted in good faith. They held up their end of a bargain, and the government's lack of oversight should not allow a retroactive and unfair solution to this problem. A country that only pretends to care about its veterans is  shameful. If a man got a $15,000 bonus and $4,000 was taken immediately for taxes, how can the government possibly come back and take the entire $15,000 from these men and women?
What's right is right, what's wrong is wrong....
I have a daughter in the Army National Guard that served in Iraq
I do not agree with the United States Army not honoring their Contract "in good faith" . I love serving but they are wrong by pursing this action
I'm a retired disabled veteran. This is appalling.
I'm not a lawyer but it seems to me there's grounds here for a joint suit against the CA ARNG and any other govt entity participating in this persecution of veterans
These soldiers signed contracts in good faith.  Contracts that guaranteed they would be put into harms way.
I retired with 20 years and im.a veteran
Stealing from those that protect us?? Shameful!!
The U.S. has to take better care of our veterans! Give them what they signed a contract for!

This is so wrong to take back awarded contract bonuses..   

Stop the nonsense..
Because it is an egregious abuse of power and the system that needs to be stopped!
I'm signing because the fact this is an absolutely deplorable things to do to vets. The fact this is even an issue to be petitioned against is sickening.

These men and women signed these contracts in good faith. They did there tours they agreed upon. They, however, cannot get back their blood, sweat or tears. They cannot un-see the things that still haunt their dreams. The families cannot get their loved ones back that didn't make it home. So this money is the very least they are entitled to. I am a taxpaying American citizen and I will support ANY funds like this for our men and women anyday.
Our men and women give us there all. Respect those who serve.
A contract is a contract. These men and women risked their lives. It's wrong to screw them!!
I  support the ones who sacrificed so much. SHAME on the government. stop this.
THIS IS BEYOND WRONG!  WE KNOW IT AND THEY KNOW IT.
I feel that they are trying to screw our vets over!
It is not right to give an incentive, then demand it back...ever...much less years after the duty was served and threatening penalties if not payed.  UN-AMERICAN!
I'm a NG Vet who is having to pay back his bonus
I'm signing because this happened to me forty years ago and i had to go to court to get a bonus that was promised to me for re-enlisting that was then eliminated after I was obligated to service.
This is beyond absurd; and a blatant betrayal of Soldiers who signed up in good faith.
This is ridiculous. If they have contracts then it is a loss to the NG, not a collection effort.

My wages are being garnished. I was onlyv paid the forest half of my bonus. I never received the second half.  Now the guard had sent me for collections.  My credit had been affected.  The amount they are trying to recoup is $7500.00. There was no way to fight this.

The notion that the government can come back AFTER THE FACT and declare these contracts are void and must be repaid?  

NO.

Unless they can give that time back to service members who signed those contracts, the government may not attempt to take back those bonuses, in any manner.

These contracts and each their languages, were mutually agreed upon, and we're performed within good faith by each military member. Services were delivered as promised, in full by each said member. The remuneration stipulated in each contract were in turn,  not delivered. This is a gross breach of contract, within exponential multiplicity. Addendums to the terms of such contracts must be mutually discussed and agreed upon, and in these instances, were cleary not. This situation I'd disgustingly deplorable.
US Army Veteran 82-93

Because to many times people who have served and their families have suffered because the paper pushers do not care, the do not care of the damage which has been and will continue to haunt many of us.
I've had several friends and family members serve in the military, and this is heinous.

I am in the army, 12 years served so far. My wife is also a service member. I have been to both Iraq and Afghanistan. I know first hand the sacrifices we make for our country and our loved ones. I don't agree with the bonuses being taken back after contracts have been fulfilled on both ends.

i'm a veteran & i have ptsd. i have had a horrible life & gave up when i was 45. i had already prayed 2 God 2 kill me & end my life but, God doesn't do that so when i was 45, i gave up again & asked God "please tell me what i am do'n wrong &/or, tell me what it is u(God) would have me do & then...

i felt like i was possessed, not like i couldn't get away) & i was lead 2 a poem regard'n God so i read the poem & then was turned loose & went 2 bed. then, the next morn'n when i woke up, i heard a voice n my ear...

This is God, My voice u hear. Please go fix yourself something 2 eat & eat it. & then...

4 the next 5 years, i did what the voice told me 2 cause, i didn't care & wouldn't have moved again, if it hadn't been 4 that voice then, 1 da. i found a childs broom shoved n2 a corner at a build'n where i workd & i asked God what he wanted me 2 do -w- the broom & He said, "place it n your vehicle. i didn't think anything of it cause i did that @ my job all the time. haul'n things from 1 build'n 2 the next but.

when i got home that night, i remember that broom was still n the vehicle(so were a lot of other things but, they were there specifically 2 go -w- me from build'n 2 buildn. i said, "God, what would u like me 2 do -w- that broom & God said "keep it" well. i said 2 myself, "thats steal'n & God wouldn't tell ,me 2 steal. i must b go'n crazy, i'm gonna have myself checked out & then...

God said "i'm go'n 2 prove 2 u it's My voice/God u hear. my son was live'n -w- me @ the time & my son is not the cleanest person. God said...

u tell ur son there is a gift n the car 4 him & when he touches it, he will know it is a gift from God cause, he will feel holy spirit so...

i called my son out of his room & told him "God said there is a gift in the car 4 u & u will know it is a gift from God cause, u will feel holy spirit when u touch it. my son headed out 2 the car 2 find the gift &...

the whole time he was out there i was pray'n "please God, don't let me b crazy" over & over & over & then...

my son came back n2 the house -w- that broom n his hand & he said "mom, i didn't even know what i had my hand on when i  felt holy spirit"

& that is the reason i am the way i am.

btw, that same week, the build'n i got the broom from was closed down. i was told, i could have anything left bhind n that build'n & i am 100% positive, if i had taken the broom back, it would have been left bhind.

i still do my best 2 do my best but above all, i will ALWAYs obey the little voice n my head cause, i know, it's not mine.

& if u'r 1 of those that physically feel holy spirit, u will know that this story is "truth", & not a lie.

  i'm try'n 2 spred my life story cause God inspired "God bless America" 4 a reason &, i can't wait until America & Americans turn back 2 the moral values this country was founded upon, "freedom, equality & justice 4 ALL!.

break'n a contract can b construed as immoral.

I am signing because I am veteran and believe that thes soldiers did what was asked of them and now are being told that they were wrong in something they had no control over, this is a bunch of BS and should be overseen by a court
As a veteran, I feel compelled. They deserve no less.
Vets earned every dollar. The Army is making a grave error.
I was medically discharged after serving 4 years and was required to pay back my signing bonus years later from the regular army.
I am signing this because it is a disgrace to treat our soldiers like this. Wake up people
This is an outrage!!! The Government is way out of line here.
They deserve everything. They put their lives in jeopardy and sacrificed to serve our country. They lost enough.
After what they went through they shouldn't owe the government anything. We will always owe them.
this is complete bullshit. My father is a lifer..serving for 21 years. Congress better figure this out,,,
Those that join the service of the USA should never have to endure broken promises
I', a vet and this is just wrong.

I'm signing because my son is a veteran and he as well as ALL others deserve to keep EVERY penny, nickel, dime, quarter, dollar they have ever been paid!!!
Support our troops people
They deserve their bonus and more.

I'm signing because I am an army veteran, who recently received a reenlistment bonus. I wouldn't know what to do if I were told to pay it back. I simply could not afford it, nor should I have to. The wrong people are being punished by this. The majority of the violations present were as a result of a lack of training in the recruiting personnel and a lack of communication. The majority of Soldiers that had contractual violations had no reasonable way to know that any violations existed. They trusted their leadership. The Soldiers were (and still are, unfortunately) being punished for something they had no control over. and then, multiple years later (some contracts as far back as 2001), they find themselves with a debt. 

What SHOULD have happened is that all of the contracts during that time period AND all personnel responsible for executing contracts in any way (from recruiting to readiness NCO's) should have been investigated for fraud. Any contract that is not found to be willfully fraudulent at the fault of the soldier should have been granted a blanket Exception to Policy. 

Also, there is a Statute of Limitations that requires that all obligated payments must be paid within 6 Fiscal Years (the FY of the payment due date + 5), or the payment expires and cannot be paid. For example, if a payment is due in January 2011, it MUST be paid BEFORE then end of FY 2016, or it expires. If payments cannot be paid out after 6 years, why then can they take money back after 6 (or more!) years?

overview:
It’s been over 23 years since I spent Thanksgiving with my mom. This year was no different. For most of my life, my mother has been behind bars, serving a life without parole sentence for a nonviolent drug offense.

My mom’s name is Cheryl Howard and I am her only child; she has 3 grand children (2 girls ages 14 and 7 and 1 boy age 13). We have always had a close relationship. One of my last memories together was Halloween when I was the Cowardly Lion from The Wiz. My mother worked so hard on my costume and I was embarrassed by my curls I had as the lion but I remember everyone telling us how great my costume was. 

This was one of the only childhood moments we had together. Then my mom started abusing drugs like cocaine. It changed everything. Soon she was arrested and in 1995 convicted of possession with intent to distribute crack cocaine, and one count of conspiracy. She was given a life sentence without the possibility of parole.

I don’t want to make excuses for my mom -- she made mistakes. But I also believe that with help for her addiction she could have gotten better. Instead she was sent to prison for the rest of her life and without clemency from President Obama, she will die there. President Obama has now granted clemency to over 1,000 nonviolent drug offenders like my mom. But only 68 have been women and time is running it out. My mother has accepted full responsibility for actions and has suffered enough. I'm begging President Obama to grant her clemency.  

While in prison she obtained her GED, completed Vocational Training and Tarrant Community College courses, (2) Pierpont College courses and creative writing courses. She has maintained employment through the Life Connections Program (LCP) which helps inmates learn life skills so that upon release she can be successful and equipped with job skills. After release she want to start a program called “Fed Up,” which stands for Federal Ex-offender’s Driven to their Unexpected, to help female ex-offenders with life coaching, counseling, and job placement.

I hear the pain in her voice when she says how remorseful she is for the crimes she committed. Her voice has kept me on the right path in raising my own family. She is truly a changed person, prepared to contribute to her community and society if released. In January 2015 she had 3 aneurysms rupture and was placed on life support for 31 days. She has recovered but I worry everyday.

That Cowardly Lion Halloween costume is symbolic because I’ve carried courage with me my entire life. For 23 years I’ve missed every precious moment most people have with their mothers. I can only guess what they feel like. I have three children she has never held as babies. I’ve even delayed my wedding in the hopes that she will be able to walk me down the aisle with my Aunt.

Please sign my petition to ask President Obama to grant clemency to a mother, grandmother, sister, aunt, and friend who deserves a second chance.

For more information regarding my mother's case and others whom deserve Justice through clemency please visit http://www.candoclemency.com/cheryl-howard http://www.candoclemency.com/

overview:
I am one of a group of Native American activists and allies who have been protesting an oil pipeline that is set to cross the Missouri River a mile away from the Standing Rock reservation, and threatens to poison our water. For months, we have been peacefully working to stop construction on what we see as a threat to the safety of all people, yet we have been met with only violence and mistreatment by law enforcement for doing what we believe is right.

The county sheriff is not doing his job, which is to protect all people in Morton County. Sign my petition asking Attorney General Wayne Stenehjem to conduct an ethics investigation into Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier and remove him from office.

Under his leadership, Morton County police have failed to protect peaceful North Dakotans from vicious dog attacks, unleashed by a private security company. Sheriff Kirchmeier has displayed bias on Facebook and in media interviews, and has withheld information from North Dakotan residents in order to further the agenda of the Dakota Access LLC.

In addition, activists are being constantly surveilled and questioned, then met with road blocks as they try to reach the camps. The sheriff’s office has regularly accused us of harassing ranchers and farmers in spite of our peaceful actions, and charges brought against nonviolent water protectors have increased. Even Amy Goodman, a renowned journalist who was present at an action, has had a warrant issued for her arrest – a clear violation of freedom of the press. The Morton County Sheriff’s Department response to our peaceful protests has been so severe that the ACLU is investigating whether they have violated the constitution.

Please join me in asking for the immediate removal of Sheriff Kirchmeier.

As citizens of this country we have the right to participate in peaceful protest without being met by a militarized and biased police force more interested in protecting corporate interests than the people of North Dakota.
